children.subject: I would guess that the weekly schedule, stress from deadline and peer pressures , etc. will help you learn the materials more effectively?

history.content: I'm taking 162 right now and it's been one of my favorite classes. I'd also say you won't really get to engage with the material nearly as meaningfully, since I feel that a lot of my learning has come from getting to do the homeworks and projects, which are difficult but incredibly rewarding. It's a very practically-oriented class, so it's not as rewarding to self study as something more theoretical.

children.subject:
My thoughts on CS162.

1. I am now quite good at debugging C programs.

2. I have a better sense for designing and implementing large projects.

3. The difficult parts of the course didn't really have anything to do with understanding concepts.

4. I could've learned and understood the core concepts in a self study context.

5. When I've interviewed and been asked OS concepts, they were at a high level, and again, I could've perhaps learned these things on my own.

Overall it was a good course, but I do think it is a little overrated. Though, many people love the course and say they get a lot out of it, so statistically, you should probably take it because you're more likely to fall into the latter category. If you're having a hard time finding a place in your schedule for it or OS is just not exciting to you, I'd say you could definitely self study and extract the important ideas out of it.
At the very least you come out of the class as a C master :)

history.content:
Class is apparently useful, but projects are apparently very time consuming and stressful.

I'd like to self study the material. Is this a mistake?
history.subject: CS 162 Worth It? Or Self Study
